description: Returns a list of open workflow executions in the specified domain that meet the filtering criteria. The results may be split into multiple pages. To retrieve subsequent pages, make the call again using the nextPageToken returned by the initial call. You can use IAM policies to control this action's access to Amazon SWF resources as follows: If the caller doesn't have sufficient permissions to invoke the action, or the parameter values fall outside the specified constraints, the action fails. The associated event attribute's cause parameter is set to OPERATION_NOT_PERMITTED. For details and example IAM policies, see Using IAM to Manage Access to Amazon SWF Workflows in the Amazon SWF Developer Guide.

parameters.name: domain
parameters.description: The name of the domain that contains the workflow executions to list.

parameters.name: startTimeFilter
parameters.description: Workflow executions are included in the returned results based on whether their start times are within the range specified by this filter. Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return. latestDate (datetime) --- Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.

nested_params.name: oldestDate
nested_params.description: Specifies the oldest start or close date and time to return.

nested_params.name: latestDate
nested_params.description: Specifies the latest start or close date and time to return.

parameters.name: typeFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only executions of the type specified in the filter are returned. Name of the workflow type. version (string) --- Version of the workflow type.

parameters.name: tagFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only executions that have the matching tag are listed. Specifies the tag that must be associated with the execution for it to meet the filter criteria. Tags may only contain unicode letters, digits, whitespace, or these symbols: _ . : / = + - @.

nested_params.name: tag
nested_params.description: Specifies the tag that must be associated with the execution for it to meet the filter criteria. Tags may only contain unicode letters, digits, whitespace, or these symbols: _ . : / = + - @.

parameters.name: nextPageToken
parameters.description: If NextPageToken is returned there are more results available. The value of NextPageToken is a unique pagination token for each page. Make the call again using the returned token to retrieve the next page. Keep all other arguments unchanged. Each pagination token expires after 24 hours. Using an expired pagination token will return a 400 error: ' Specified token has exceeded its maximum lifetime'. The configured maximumPageSize determines how many results can be returned in a single call.

parameters.name: executionFilter
parameters.description: If specified, only workflow executions matching the workflow ID specified in the filter are returned. The workflowId to pass of match the criteria of this filter.

nested_params.name: workflowId
nested_params.description: The workflowId to pass of match the criteria of this filter.

nested_items.name: executionInfos
nested_items.description: The list of workflow information structures.

nested_items.name: execution
nested_items.description: The workflow execution this information is about.

nested_items.name: workflowId
nested_items.description: The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: runId
nested_items.description: A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: workflowType
nested_items.description: The type of the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the workflow type.

nested_items.name: version
nested_items.description: The version of the workflow type.

nested_items.name: startTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the execution was started.

nested_items.name: closeTimestamp
nested_items.description: The time when the workflow execution was closed. Set only if the execution status is CLOSED.

nested_items.name: executionStatus
nested_items.description: The current status of the execution.

nested_items.name: closeStatus
nested_items.description: If the execution status is closed then this specifies how the execution was closed:
COMPLETED --- the execution was successfully completed.
CANCELED --- the execution was canceled.Cancellation allows the implementation to gracefully clean up before the execution is closed.
TERMINATED --- the execution was force terminated.
FAILED --- the execution failed to complete.
TIMED_OUT --- the execution did not complete in the alloted time and was automatically timed out.
CONTINUED_AS_NEW --- the execution is logically continued. This means the current execution was completed and a new execution was started to carry on the workflow.

nested_items.name: workflowId
nested_items.description: The user defined identifier associated with the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: runId
nested_items.description: A system-generated unique identifier for the workflow execution.

nested_items.name: tagList
nested_items.description: The list of tags associated with the workflow execution. Tags can be used to identify and list workflow executions of interest through the visibility APIs. A workflow execution can have a maximum of 5 tags.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: cancelRequested
nested_items.description: Set to true if a cancellation is requested for this workflow execution.

nested_items.name: nextPageToken
nested_items.description: If a NextPageToken was returned by a previous call, there are more results available. To retrieve the next page of results, make the call again using the returned token in nextPageToken. Keep all other arguments unchanged.
